meanings.definition: The act of continuing or preserving something indefinitely.
meanings.sent1: The perpetuations of traditions keep our culture alive.
meanings.sent2: The perpetuations of rumors can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The perpetuations of jokes at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The perpetuations of memories in her mind were like a never-ending movie reel.
meanings.sent5: The perpetuations of kindness create a ripple effect of positivity.

meanings.definition: The continuation of a situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: The perpetuations of the storm caused flooding in the area.
meanings.sent2: The perpetuations of the argument made it difficult to find a resolution.
meanings.sent3: The perpetuations of the traffic jam made him late for work.
meanings.sent4: The perpetuations of the problem felt like a never-ending maze.
meanings.sent5: The perpetuations of the music filled the room with joy.
